name: Blueberry Ricotta Squares
author: AuntieJ
summary: A blueberry coffeecake with a ricotta cheese topping. Reminiscent of cheesecake, this recipe was in my maternal grandmother's collection. Origin is unknown.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease a 9 inch square baking dish
In a large bowl, stir together the flour, 3/4 cup of sugar, and baking powder
Add the milk, shortening, 1 egg, and lemon extract, and use an electric mixer to mix on low speed for 1 minute, then on medium speed for 1 minute
Pour the batter into the prepared pan, and spread evenly
In a medium bowl, stir together 2 beaten eggs, ricotta cheese, 1/3 cup of sugar, and vanilla extract
Spoon this mixture over the blueberries, and spread evenly
Bake for 55 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean
Cool completely before cutting into squares and serving
